reviews.text: Benfleet station is pretty straight forward, staff seemed to know what they was doing. I did notice how people did not even say thank you or acknowledge staff members for giving them tickets etc. And I really do not approve of the rudeness people blatantly gave to staff. Station was clean and the trains where running on time.

Sole ticket machine would only accept cards but only one person was selling them by hand so a large queue of customers built up. Eventually another position opened but both pulled down the shutters shortly thereafter as the computer system crashed – cue another large queue while attempts were made to reboot it. Apalling communication with those waiting, most of whom had no idea what the hold up was.

Station itself rather pleasant, at least on a warm summerʼs day. The ticket office, however, is situated on the opposite side of the station to the car park and with no footbridge this means a long trek round to get there (inside the station an underpass allows access to the opposite platform). Large and secure bike rack as well as pick up and drop off point for vehicles.

manz went 2 da op blok and dem paygon seetwosee chrayn ofeecaz niked mah flik ting and kald mah marj

- harrisonmeltville2trappy
Always a 20 minute queue for tickets in the morning. Lack of staff.

Ticket machine has been broken for 8 months...weekends a lottery if there are any staff but c2c happy to employ ticket checkers. The disabled facilities at Benfleet are attrocious. C2C should be ashamed no clear signs to the two disabled ramp entrances. No clear instructions on how to operate them.Reliant on someone pressing the button in the ticket cave...very hit and miss non existent at night. For one of the busiest stations it’s an awful little rats nest with sullen snippy staff. An example of failed privatisation all for money and sod the proles, especially if they are disabled.
